Job Title: Cypress HCM hiring Senior Technical Writer, Game Developer Tools, 2643-1 in Los Angeles, CA
Description: This contract position seeks a Senior Technical Writer to develop documentation for a games platform, SDK, and APIs. The role involves collaborating with engineers and product teams to transform complex technical information into developer-friendly content. Key responsibilities include creating and maintaining technical documentation, partnering with cross-functional teams to gather information, establishing documentation standards, and communicating updates to internal and external stakeholders. Required qualifications: 5+ years in technical writing or related fields, experience working with engineering teams, autonomous work capability, strong communication skills, Git proficiency, and markup language expertise (Markdown/HTML). Preferred skills include game development experience, design systems knowledge, gaming background, and familiarity with distributed team environments. Compensation: $80-$90 per hour (contract position).

Job Title: Snowflake hiring Senior Technical Writer in Bellevue, WA
Description: Snowflake seeks a Senior Technical Writer to create online guides, reference docs, and tutorials for technical audiences including SQL engineers and developers. The role involves collaborating with product managers, engineers, and UI designers to document features and changes, coordinating with release engineers for weekly updates, and supporting customer engagement through knowledge base articles, blog posts, and training materials. Requirements: 10+ years creating technical product documentation, strong SQL and RDBMS expertise, experience documenting security/governance technologies (IAM, networking, data governance), knowledge of content development lifecycle. Desired qualifications include ETL/ELT and BI technology familiarity, cloud platform experience (AWS, Azure, GCP), programming language knowledge, and docs-as-code tools (Git, Markdown, RST/Sphinx, DITA XML). Compensation: $126,000-$181,700 base salary, plus bonus and equity eligibility.

Job Title: GEICO hiring Senior Taxonomist in Seattle, WA
Description: GEICO seeks an experienced taxonomist for its Enterprise Data team. The role focuses on structuring the data and language that powers machine learning models, generative AI applications, NLP use cases, and enterprise knowledge graphs. Key responsibilities include developing taxonomies and controlled vocabularies, partnering with data scientists on dataset labeling, collaborating with engineering teams on search enhancement, establishing data annotation standards, and ensuring alignment with industry frameworks like ACORD standards. The position also involves evaluating automated classification tools and implementing semantic standards like SKOS. Requirements: Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, linguistics, or related field; 5+ years developing taxonomies in regulated industries (insurance/financial services preferred); Python and SQL proficiency; graph database experience; and strong communication skills bridging technical and business teams. Compensation: $110,000-$230,000 annually.

Job Title: Apple hiring Technical Writer, Applications in Seattle, WA
Description: Apple's Applications team seeks a technical writer for Apple Creator Studio. This role combines specification writing and UX copy creation, allowing the candidate to influence product development from conceptual stages through testing. The position involves gathering requirements from Design, Product Management, Engineering, and stakeholders; writing detailed specifications capturing use cases, edge cases, and functional requirements; crafting user interface copy for millions of Apple device users; presenting proposed copy to senior executives; and leading documentation review meetings with 5-50 participants. Requirements: 1+ year software-related technical writing experience, ability to document complex multi-platform apps (Mac, iPad, iPhone), strong requirement-gathering and stakeholder communication skills, proficiency identifying use cases and edge cases, excellent writing, grammar, and style guide adherence, meticulous organizational abilities, public presentation experience, and BS/BA in Technical Writing, English, Computer Science, or related field. Compensation: $112,500-$231,700 annually, plus stock options, comprehensive benefits, and potential bonuses.

Job Title: Databricks hiring Sr. Technical Writer, AI & Machine Learning in Seattle, WA
Description: Databricks seeks a senior technical writer to create customer-focused documentation for their AI/ML platform. The role involves collaborating with engineers and product managers to develop documentation for developers and data engineers. Key responsibilities include developing effective, customer-focused technical documentation, collaborating with technical staff on best practices and guidance, guiding information architecture around customer use cases, editing content for accuracy and style adherence, creating diagrams and visual aids, and staying current with evolving AI/ML technologies. Requirements: 4+ years documenting sophisticated technologies for developers, in-person work in Bay Area or Seattle offices required, strong technical writing expertise and grammar skills, experience with ML/generative AI concepts, proficiency with Markdown, Git, and GitHub, and cross-functional collaboration skills. Compensation: $118,200-$162,600 USD (Zone 2).

Job Title: CoreWeave hiring Senior Technical Writer in Bellevue, WA
Description: CoreWeave seeks a Senior Technical Writer to join their documentation team. The role involves creating product documentation, tutorials, guides, and example scripts for infrastructure offerings. Key responsibilities include testing user workflows, aggregating customer feedback from support and sales teams, and maintaining documentation style consistency. Preferred qualifications include experience with LLM APIs and ML frameworks (Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch), self-directed approach with ownership mentality, and strong communication and organizational skills. Compensation: Base salary $165,000-$242,000 annually, plus discretionary bonus, equity awards, and comprehensive benefits including health insurance, 401(k) matching, flexible PTO, and parental leave support.

Job Title: Meta hiring Content Engineer in Menlo Park, CA
Description: Meta's Superintelligence Labs seeks a content engineer to shape AI product experiences through strategy and prompt engineering. The role involves directing large-language model behavior, partnering with technical and product teams, and building experiences that entertain, inform and delight. Required qualifications: experience collaborating with product/technical teams, editing proficiency, critical thinking and editorial judgment on nuanced topics, cross-functional project leadership, and GenAI experience, particularly model evaluation and strategic planning. Preferred qualifications include product roadmapping experience, prompt engineering and annotation background, and AP Style familiarity. Compensation: $242,000-$296,000 annually, plus bonus, equity, and benefits.

Job Title: Datadog hiring Technical Writer in Washington, United States
Description: Datadog seeks a technical writer to join their Writing & Documentation team. The role involves partnering with product and engineering teams to create public user documentation for observability and automation products, particularly for Datadog Docs. Key responsibilities include managing documentation projects and creating public user documentation, gathering technical details through product review and hands-on testing, creating developer-facing documentation for SDKs, APIs, and developer tools, maintaining documentation standards and contributing to process improvements, participating in interrupt-handling rotation for documentation requests, and reviewing and providing editorial feedback on documentation. Requirements: minimum 3 years technical writing experience with developer documentation, proficiency in Markdown, static-site generators, and Github (docs as code), ability to read and understand code in programming languages, familiarity with cloud services and containers, public technical writing samples, experience with complex multi-interaction platforms, and experience using AI tools in documentation work. Compensation: $125,000-$155,000 USD annually.

Job Title: RevenueCat hiring Senior Documentation Manager in United States

Requirements: 5-8+ years in technical documentation or developer education, experience with git-based, markdown-driven systems (Docusaurus preferred), strong editorial mindset with technical depth, and proven track record designing processes for documentation accuracy. Compensation: $169,000/year base pay. Benefits include equity in Series C startup, remote work, 4-5 weeks PTO, workspace stipend, and learning budget.

Job Title: LaunchDarkly hiring Staff Content Designer in Seattle, WA
Description: LaunchDarkly seeks their inaugural Content Designer to enhance product accessibility and comprehension. Benefits include RSUs, health/dental/vision/mental health coverage.

Job Title: Walrus Foundation hiring Senior Technical Writer in United States
Description: Walrus Foundation seeks a Technical Writer for their Documentation Experience team, reporting to the Head of Developer Relations. The role involves creating content that supports developers, node operators, and partners using Mysten Labs' technologies. Key responsibilities include writing, designing, and updating documentation and sample code, collaborating across Engineering, Product, Marketing, and Developer Relations teams, and contributing to documentation tooling and processes. Ideal candidate qualities include welcoming feedback and being open to new ideas, building rapport with technical writing team members, creating content reducing support costs, understanding blockchain technology and verifying technical accuracy, and writing sample code supporting documentation. Helpful experience includes project management and familiarity with Sui and Move ecosystem. Compensation: $152,000-$209,000 annually.

Job Title: OpenFX hiring Senior Technical Writer, API Documentation in London, OH
Description: OpenFX seeks a founding-level technical writer to build comprehensive API documentation for their cross-border payment infrastructure. The position involves establishing documentation systems from scratch, translating complex financial engineering into developer-friendly content, and ensuring integration complexity becomes approachable. Key responsibilities include designing information architecture and taxonomy scaling from quickstart guides to advanced treasury references, selecting and implementing the API documentation platform tech stack, translating engineering concepts into developer-focused explanations covering idempotency, webhooks, and settlement states, implementing OpenAPI/Swagger workflows as product contracts with automated reference generation, participating in product and engineering reviews as the first user providing feedback on API usability before production, creating quickstart guides and code snippets targeting sub-15-minute integration time, and reducing support tickets by 40% through comprehensive documentation. Success metrics include launching a public developer portal with references, guides, and changelog, achieving 100% endpoint coverage with examples in three languages, and enabling first API calls within 15 minutes. Required qualifications: 5+ years documenting REST APIs for B2B/infrastructure products, docs-as-code proficiency (Markdown, Git, CI/CD workflows), code-reading ability and distributed systems understanding, demonstrated ability simplifying complex concepts into linear guides, portfolio showing conceptual why explanations over feature descriptions, comfort building documentation systems independently, and fintech/payments domain knowledge. Preferred skills include interactive documentation implementation (code playgrounds, Try it now features), multimedia creation (videos, diagrams, architecture visualizations), and AI-assisted development workflow optimization.

Job Title: Midi Health hiring Senior Editor, Content in United States
Description: Midi Health operates a virtual clinic specializing in women's midlife health, providing insurance-covered care for perimenopause and menopause management. The organization combines clinical expertise with technology and has secured backing from top-tier investors while serving hundreds of thousands of patients across the United States. Key responsibilities include overseeing the editorial calendar and production workflow, serving as final editorial authority before publication, managing freelance contributor networks, operating the Prismic CMS platform, coordinating with content leadership on strategy, collaborating with creative teams on visual assets, mentoring writers and editors, and identifying opportunities to enhance content quality and operational efficiency. Required qualifications: 5-7 years of editorial experience in content marketing, SEO, or publishing (ideally healthcare-focused), strong editorial judgment, exceptional writing and editing abilities, proficiency managing freelance networks, organizational capacity for multiple concurrent projects, hands-on CMS experience, and cross-functional communication skills. Bonus qualifications include medical or expert review workflow experience and startup environment background. Compensation: $140,000-$165,000 annually (base pay), with equity and benefits included.

Job Title: Zscaler hiring Senior Web Content Writer in United States
Description: Zscaler seeks a Senior Web Content Writer to create and optimize website content to drive organic growth. Key responsibilities include developing web pages, blogs, and solution content aligned with priority keywords and search intent, partnering with SEO/AEO teams to enhance on-page performance through metadata optimization and internal linking, collaborating cross-functionally with subject matter experts, product marketing, UX/design, and engineering teams, auditing and refreshing existing content to maintain quality standards aligned with E-E-A-T principles, and using AI responsibly for ideation and early drafts while maintaining quality control. Minimum qualifications: 3+ years of web/content writing experience (SaaS/B2B tech preferred; cybersecurity experience valued), demonstrated understanding of SEO/AEO principles and content structuring, strong writing, editing, and storytelling abilities with voice adaptability, comfort using AI tools while maintaining rigorous quality standards, and experience with multilingual content workflows and localization. Preferred qualifications include CMS familiarity (Drupal preferred) and basic HTML knowledge, and working knowledge of content analytics tools (Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush). Compensation: $115,500-$165,000 USD annually.

Job Title: Garner Health hiring Senior Content Designer in United States
Description: Garner Health transforms healthcare by partnering with employers to redesign benefits using data-driven insights and incentives that guide employees toward higher-quality, lower-cost care. This position reports to the Head of Product Design and centers on managing all in-app content, including systems, voice/tone guidelines, processes, and copy implementation. Key responsibilities include simplifying complex healthcare concepts into user-friendly copy through cross-team collaboration, establishing and refining copy development processes including translation and approval workflows, developing and maintaining a scalable content management system, aligning in-app messaging with brand voice and marketing objectives, and conducting consistency audits, user testing, and iterative improvements independently. Required qualifications: exceptional writing ability focused on clarity and efficiency, proven experience managing UX copy systems at scale (Contentful experience preferred), strong ownership mentality with proactive improvement mindset, excellent stakeholder management and collaboration skills, adaptability with emerging technologies including AI integration, and capacity to manage multiple concurrent projects across teams. Compensation: $167,000-$200,000 annually, plus equity participation, flexible PTO, health insurance options (medical/dental/vision), 401(k), Teladoc Health, and additional competitive benefits.

Job Title: Confluent hiring Senior Technical Writer in United States
Description: Confluent seeks a technical writer to document their Apache Kafka distribution. The company emphasizes a culture that values documentation, enabling writers to receive input from engineers and the community while helping developers adopt their streaming platform. Key responsibilities include collaborating across Engineering, Product, and Support teams to create high-quality documentation ensuring customer success, producing documentation featuring unified examples, consistent style, and jaw-dropping quality, and creating SEO-friendly, LLM-optimized content that is searchable, browsable, and automated.
